projects.name: aPaperADay Blog
projects.short: I've been reading and commenting on a Deep Learning Papers for the past two years.  In the beginning, it took me quite a while to understand the papers, but I'm getting much faster.  I typically get seasons when I can maintain it daily.  Some of my favorite papers are anything with Kaiming, the BERT paper, and I really enjoyed reading the Graphcore patent.

projects.name: Personal Portfolio
projects.short: This Website.  I took (with permission) from crearo's public github repo and primarily modified the cards on the projects page, and added an acknowledgements page. Hosted on AWS Elastic Beanstalk.

projects.name: Violin Build
projects.short: This was a two year build that started in my summers during college.  It was a full build from scratch that I did by following a book and I'm very happy with how it turned out  I even took lessons on it during my last year of college.

projects.name: Apple Health Data Analysis
projects.short: A project inspecting my Apple Health Data, particularly trying to predict Vo2Max based on workouts with ensemble tree based methods.

projects.name: Report on Feature Importance
projects.short: Some writing I did on describing Feature Importance metrics, including mRMR, Drop Column, Permutation Column and Gini Drop.  Read More to see the report on Github.

projects.name: Scrape Surfline Cam Rewinds
projects.short: I needed to get the surfline cams downloaded, and the open-source code was broken, so I wrote a Selenium script to grab the needed data.

projects.name: 8 Bit Computer
projects.short: This was a computer architecture project I had a blast creating! I built a bare level machine that loaded constants into both registers, added, stored, recalled, then passed those bits to the output lines.

projects.name: Card Classifier
projects.short: The Card Classifier is a deep learning project as a proof of concept for machine vision. Below you can see the classifications across a fanned deck of cards.  Images are transformed down to (360,200), run through a ResNet-50 backbone and classified into  1 of 53 classes, where the additional class is just a background class.

projects.name: SF Citywatch Startup
projects.short: A VC pitched project through the Masters of Data Science Program at University of San Francisco, promoting true safety and surrounding awareness through trending crime analysis
